title: Why did RITO remove mana potions?

replies.body:
So that they could better balance the mana-regen/flat mana items during and after the MYMU.

Mana potions made it really hard to balance some champs to the point where they had to keep their costs high in case someone was stacking pots in lane.  They tweaked many champs' base and mp5 at the same time to make up for it.
Because champions that were balanced around stronger abilities but heavier mana costs in early could just buy those and not worry at all?
Because buying mana is difficult to balance and has no reason to exist. Mandatory purchases are not good for game health.

Many champions were designed to be gated by mana early-game, but Mana Potions helped them circumvent that restriction.

Clearly, you have never had to face a Yorick who walked into lane with Crystalline Flash, two health potions and two mana potions.
